title: Azir's new Rework
body: So I've played the new Azir rework and to be completely honest the new q range is disgustingly bad and the auto attack range is the exact same I really hope riot looks more into Azir and buffs his Aa range and q range even slightly because at the moment as A mage I have to be really close in the fights to throw my soldiers forward with q and even auto attack making myself very vulnerable. Another thing Is you can't Shurima shuffle that well any more or make outplays with q because of how small the q range is.. I really hope Riot understands this.

replies.body:
I wont comment too much here as Im still in the early days of testing it and will likely make an essay on it later.

But from what little I've played so far, it really feels like they tried _(and failed)_ to make him a diver.

With the reduced range you can no longer be _partially-safe_ when poking _(like Xerath and Lux and old Azir can)_. You are at the full mercy of most assassins/burst mages when in that range, so poke isn't much of an option anymore. So the only way you can win fights is to get that 3rd soldier on the field and get the AS boost! But to do that you HAVE to hit that E on a champion, _(you don't live long enough to get the 3rd soldier any other way)_ . The problem is, to hit the E, you have to dash headlong into the fight, which is not something that Azir is equipped to survive.

They changed the shield to scale off AP thats true, _(which tbh is more of a bug-fix than anything else, because they weren't fooling anyone with that max-hp scaling they had before, it was just as useful as no shield at all)_.

And the one thing that could have helped Azir work in this kind of diving situation _(the impassable wall)_, they just flat out removed!


_________

So what Azir is now is a ** squishy poke mage**, with **shit range** and who is rewarded for **leaping headlong** into the enemy team with almost no defence.... What kind of backwards kit is that?

It's like giving a support a heal that gets bigger with the more health the target they are healing has... it kinda defeats the whole purpose.

But in fear of rambling on for hours, thats all all say for now.

but you get literally squads now, why have 3 when you can have 5 or more? Just you wait for urf, you will have a freaking blast.

armay

I gotta say though, for now, until we get URF, it feels terrible. You no longer have any range and what little range you do have makes you so vulnerable to ANY enemy. You're still squishy and you no longer have the one thing that (most) people would play Azir for. The long-range poke{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}
he does so much more damage though, even without urf, he gets like a 1.2k shield for 2 sec while he nukes everything around him with 5 soldiers

Trust me when I say, you don't live anywhere near long enough to get close to 5 soldiers!
It's like saying "Well Sion is immortal because he gains permanent HP stacks." Yes, in theory he can become immortal, but no game ever ever goes on long enough for him to do so, so it doesn't really have an impact on his balance.

To even have a chance at 5, you need to dash headlong into an enemy, and being in the midst of battle is not somewhere where Azir excels.

2 soldiers is normal.
3 is either lucky or well played.
4 requires intense planning, and/or bad focus on the enemy team's behalf.
5 requires intense planning, full CDR, dashing into the middle of a fight _(whilst somehow not being bursted into oblivion)_, bad enemy team focus, and even then you only get it for a fraction of a second before the first solider expires.

So it isn't something that you can reliably plan for.
But I haven't tried for 5 soldiers yet, I'm content with my 3 (occasionally 4 in drawn out battles), so i can't talk too much about 5.

Plus _(and this is dumb)_, if you have more than 3 soldiers, when you Q at max range, it puts some of them into the dormant stage because it puts them out of range, so you can't actually use more than 3 anyway if you use Q....

Not to mention that his soldiers do less damage to things other than the primary target now _(at least for much of the game)_, which more than compensates for having an extra 1 _(or very occasionally 2)_ extra soldiers.

Also where did you see him with a 1.2k shield?
My shield averages about 400-600 max. Admittedly I build him with a lot of utility rather than just straight glass-cannon AP, but still, that seems a little high from what I've seen.

He does a lot of damage it's true, but it requires a fair bit of setup, and then some time to actually auto attack as well, so theres little chance he would be able to out-damage champs like Zed or Ryze in a duel, champs who have access to their entire kit from the get-go.

But I'm still trying it out and testing him, so ill refrain from any concrete conclusions just yet.

My first impression is definitely negative though, mostly because of the Shurima Shuffle range decrease. and the random red crap that pops up when you get your AS boost...
